attributes.action: Expedite the bypassing of Stonehenge and dual the A303 fully to the West Country
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The A303 is a vital road link to the West Country, it serves as a major artery for people living in the area for both work and recreation. It also has to deal with the massive amount of seasonal tourist traffic visiting the area, mainly, but not exclusively, during the Summer months.

As most of you know, the road passes within close proximity to the World Heritage Site of Stonehenge. Surely we owe it to our forefathers to remove all modern construction, including roads, from within the area of the monument and give it the respect it so badly deserves. This would clearly involve building a new road solution either far from the site or a concealed tunnel.

The junction close to the monument is an incredibly dangerous one, long delays are caused by the poor & out-dated design which in turn leads to driver frustration and accidents.

Please sign this petition to apply much needed pressure on the government to improve the situation at Stonehenge and indeed the remainder of the A303.

Doug Oliver

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
